sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A Minsk court has sentenced former Belarus presidential candidate Svetlana Tikhanovskaya to 15 years in prison in absentia. She is accused of multiple crimes,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: including conspiracy to seize state power and incitement of social discord.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Authorities began cases against Tikhanovskaya and other Belarus opposition figures after disputed elections in 2020, which led to mass protests and a corresponding brutal crackdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The court also handed down an 18-year sentence in a penal colony to Pavel Latushko, who's in exile.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He's the former Belarusian ambassador to France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Tikhanovskaya has called the trial and other similar cases against opposition figures a farce and revenge on the part of Alexander Lukashenko, the Belarusian president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Moscow has published new images of Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu touring what they say are Moscow-controlled eastern regions of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He has conducted an inspection in Mariupol, a city that Russia has occupied since May last year, after months of blockade and relentless bombing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: blockade and relentless bombing. As a result of the fighting, Ukraine estimates that up to 90 percent of residential buildings have been destroyed or damaged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia says that Shoigu handed out medals to the Kremlin servicemen in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His tour comes amid the confrontation between the army and the mercenary group Wagner, who are involved in the invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Tuesday, its founder, Yevgeny Prigozhin, suggests that his force was being, quote, betrayed by being denied ammunition supplies by the army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces may be conducting a limited fighting withdrawal in eastern Bakhmut and are continuing to inflict high casualties against the advancing mixed Russian forces. The Ukrainian defense of Bakhmut remains strategically sound, that is, continues to consume Russian manpower and equipment as long as Ukrainian forces do not suffer excessive casualties. The Institute for the Study of War says Ukrainian forces are unlikely to withdraw from Bakhmut all at once and may pursue a gradual fighting withdrawal to exhaust Russian forces through continued urban warfare. Now the think tank says Russian forces are unlikely to quickly secure significant territorial gains when conducting urban warfare which usually favors the defender. The Bakhmut city center is located on the western bank of the Bakhmut Kareva and Russian forces will need to fight through the area if they're unable to advance directly north or south of Bakhmut to the west of the city center after nine months of highly attritional slow Russian advances in there in this area the Institute for the Study of War says it is still too early to assess Ukrainian intentions concerning a complete withdrawal from the city. In this area Ukrainian forces are holding their positions with a distance of around four kilometers apart. The Russian offensive to capture Bakhmut will likely culminate whether Russian forces capture the city or not and the Russian military will likely struggle to maintain any subsequent offensive operations for some months the Institute for the study of war adds the likely imminent culmination of the Russian offensive around Bakhmut the already culminated Russian offensive around to look like that the stalling Russian offensive in Luhansk region are likely setting robust conditions for Ukrainian counter-offensive operations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A six-party alliance has nominated Kemal Kariçaloglu as its common candidate to challenge President Recep Tayyip Erdogan

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: in Turkey's presidential elections in May, ending months of uncertainty and bickering that has frustrated their supporters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The elections could shift the country towards a more democratic course, or extend Erdogan's increasingly authoritarian rule into a third decade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The process to decide on one unified candidate hasn't been easy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One leader broke away from the alliance on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, he was convinced to rejoin after a compromise deal was reached. Erdogan has stated that the focus of the government until the elections will be aiding earthquake-affected regions in the southeast, where over 45,000 people have died. While Erdogan has retained large levels of support in previous terms, a perceived lacking response to the natural disaster along with rampant inflation has dented his popularity Turkey is still reeling a month after the devastating earthquake of February

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: First, the European Parliament, now the European Commission, as the E.U.'s trouble related

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to Qatar continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The bloc's watchdog has asked the commission to provide details on business trips made by its senior members, after the director general of its transport department Heinrich Hollerley reportedly traveled several times at the expense of the Qatari government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It happened while the commission was negotiating an E.U.-Qatar air transport agreement that now allows all Qatari airlines to operate direct flights to and from any European airport and vice versa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The commission recognized that the trips were paid by Qatar, but denies any conflict of interest given that Heinrich Hollerley was not directly involved in the negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Either way, these kind of invitations have to be cleared, and in this case, it was Hollerley himself who authorized the trips.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When it comes to the Director General, as head of department, he is in charge of assessing whether there is a potential for conflict of interest involved in the mission that we are talking about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So in other words, he himself is the authorising officer who is supposed to conduct this analysis. This is the procedure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: While the EU watchdog chief Emily O'Reilly underlines how the direct general ultimately takes responsibility for these negotiations, some MEPs in the European Parliament are pushing for absolute clarity on the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has until June to answer the questions of the EU Ombudsman as it carries out its investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Families have protested in Tehran after several hundred cases of gas poisoning of girls in more than 52 schools in the last three months the chemical compounds caused them to vomit and become dizzy more than a thousand students have fallen ill and an unknown number were admitted to hospitals in his first comments on the mystery poisoning Iran supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, says those behind the poisoning should face severe punishment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He also says it's a serious and unforgivable crime and there'll be no amnesty for the perpetrators. However, Iranian officials haven't announced any arrests so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the judiciary chief says anyone arrested would be put on trial and charged with corruption on earth, which would lead to the death penalty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The poisonings began last November against the backdrop of anti-government protests that erupted across the country after the death of a young woman who was arrested for wearing the headscarf incorrectly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The authorities have not yet identified the gas used or the reasons why the girls were attacked in this way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: the reasons why the girls were attacked in this way. Parliamentarians in Georgia came to blows over a proposed foreign agents law, which is similar to a measure passed in Russia that has been used to clamp down on the opposition and some NGOs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The opposition has denounced the bill as a gag law that moves the country away from the path to join the European Union. Proponents argue that the bills do not refer to individuals and have no negative stigmatizing effect.

sentences.sentence: During the chaos, hundreds of pro-European demonstrators unfurled a giant Georgian and EU flag in front of Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
